sense.name: fill, assign to or burden, add, intensify
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 LOAD NP2 Includes: LOAD UP, LOAD DOWN.
sense.examples: We loaded the gear and took off for the northern woods. Abraham loaded the livestock onto the barge. With hands trembling he loaded the wafers in the wafer prober. He loaded the Griffin with the bottles and took to the sky. She loaded up the injured, her son and his nanny, and left Berlin. The girl's mother loaded us down with the wealth of the village. He loaded the gun with silver bullets. Werewolves beware! Her eyes filled up as she loaded the weapon. He loaded the film and began to shoot. John loaded the punch with alcohol. Ezra Pound loaded up each line of poetry with obscure literary references. To load the stakes even more, Jacobs bet his watch and the title to his car. Congress loaded the bill with useless provisions.

sense.name: BASEBALL: fill up first, second and third base
sense.examples: DeJardin found himself battling his nerves when he loaded the bases. He loaded the bases again in the fourth.

sense.name: COMPUTERS: start up a saved program
sense.examples: He loaded the program again; it took 2 minutes. Once the program has loaded, scroll down a bit and you'll see the link.
